Author: [Highlight@Author]: Vawser
Title: Basics: Add a Treasure Chest
Contents: [Header]Implementation Details
Letters between the < and > symbols means you need to replace those letters with suitable numbers based on the map ID.
XX means the first set of 2 digits of the map. For m60 maps, the XX is 10.
YY means the second set of 2 digits of the map
ZZ means the third set of 2 digits of the map
It is recommended you duplicate an existing entry and then edit it, rather that create a new entry via the Create menu.
[Highlight@Treasure]: setup the treasure.
[Highlight@ObjAct]: handles the chest interaction.
[Highlight@Asset]: a target asset to hold the treasure, typically AEG099_630, the chest model.
[Header]Treasure
Add a new Treasure map object and change the following properties:
[Highlight@EventID]: this number needs to be unique.
[Highlight@PartName]: needs to be the name of the Collision or MapPiece the chest is on.
[Highlight@TreasurePartName]: needs to be the Name of the chest Asset, e.g. AEG099_630_9000.
[Highlight@ItemLotID]: needs to be the the ItemLotParam_map row id you intend to use.
[Highlight@InChest]: needs to be 1.
[Highlight@StartDisabled]: needs to be 1.
[Header]ObjAct
Add a new ObjAct map object and change the following properties:
[Highlight@EventID]: this number needs to be unique.
[Highlight@PartName]: needs to be the Name of the Collision or MapPiece the chest is on.
[Highlight@ObjActEntityID]: change to <XXYY>3250.
[Highlight@ObjActPartName]: needs to be the Name of the chest Asset object.
[Highlight@ObjActID]: should be 200 (this is the default chest ObjAct)
[Highlight@StateType]: needs to be 5
[Highlight@EventFlag]: change to <XXYY>8250
[Header]Asset
Add a new Asset map object and change the following properties:
[Highlight@Name]: needs to be a unique Name.
[Highlight@UnkPartNames]: needs to be the Name of the Collision that the Asset is on.
[Highlight@EntityID]: change to <XXYY>1250
